title: The example for Option `is_some_and` method is broken

labels.name: A-docs
labels.description: Area: documentation for any part of the project, including the compiler, standard library, and tools

body:
<!--

Thank you for finding a documentation problem! 📚

Documentation problems might be grammatical issues, typos, or unclear wording, please provide details regarding the documentation including where it is present.

Note: If your issue is for one of these, please use their dedicated issue tracker instead:

- The Rust Book: https://github.com/rust-lang/book/issues
- Rust by Example: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-by-example/issues
- The Edition Guide: https://github.com/rust-lang/edition-guide/issues
- The Cargo Book: https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues
- The Clippy Book: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/issues
- The Reference: https://github.com/rust-lang/reference/issues
- The Rustonomicon: https://github.com/rust-lang/nomicon/issues
- The Embedded Book: https://github.com/rust-embedded/book/issues

All other documentation issues should be filed here.

Or, if you find an issue related to rustdoc (e.g. doctest, rustdoc UI), please use the bug report or blank issue template instead.

-->

### Location

https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/option/enum.Option.html#method.is_some_and

### Summary

The example for Option `is_some_and` method is broken. The feature macro in the example is `!#[feature(is_some_with)]` but should be `!#[feature(is_some_and)]`. This causes the following errors when running the example
```
Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[[E0635]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/error-index.html#E0635): unknown feature `is_some_with`
 --> src/main.rs:2:12
  |
2 | #![feature(is_some_with)]
  |            ^^^^^^^^^^^^

error[[E0658]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/error-index.html#E0658): use of unstable library feature 'is_some_and'
 --> src/main.rs:6:14
  |
6 | assert_eq!(x.is_some_and(|&x| x > 1), true);
  |              ^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: [see issue #93050 <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/93050>](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/93050) for more information
  = help: [add `#![feature(is_some_and)]`](https://play.rust-lang.org/?code=%23!%5Ballow(unused)%5D%0A%23!%5Bfeature(is_some_with)%5D%0A%0Afn%20main()%20%7B%0Alet%20x%3A%20Option%3Cu32%3E%20%3D%20Some(2)%3B%0Aassert_eq!(x.is_some_and(%7C%26x%7C%20x%20%3E%201)%2C%20true)%3B%0A%0Alet%20x%3A%20Option%3Cu32%3E%20%3D%20Some(0)%3B%0Aassert_eq!(x.is_some_and(%7C%26x%7C%20x%20%3E%201)%2C%20false)%3B%0A%0Alet%20x%3A%20Option%3Cu32%3E%20%3D%20None%3B%0Aassert_eq!(x.is_some_and(%7C%26x%7C%20x%20%3E%201)%2C%20false)%3B%0A%7D&version=nightly&edition=2021#) to the crate attributes to enable

...
```
